title: Where did Russia come from? - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: What was the main reason for the rise of Kievan Rus?

options.label: A
options.text: The Vikings' acceptance of the tribes' invitation to return and establish order.

options.label: B
options.text: The region's tribes revolted against the Viking invasion.

options.label: C
options.text: The tribes turned to the foreigners they had just expelled for help.

options.label: D
options.text: The tribes were united under a single leader.

multiple-choice.question: What was the significance of the Primary Chronicle in understanding the history of Kievan Rus?

options.label: A
options.text: It was compiled by a Roman scholar in the 12th century.

options.label: B
options.text: It was written by a monk named Nestor and provides a detailed account of the region's history.

options.label: C
options.text: It was the only source of information about the region's tribes.

options.label: D
options.text: It was lost forever in the 13th century.

multiple-choice.question: What characterized the relationships between the Kievan Rus and its neighbors?

options.label: A
options.text: The Kievan Rus had a more advanced writing system.

options.label: B
options.text: The Kievan Rus was ruled by a single emperor.

options.label: C
options.text: The Kievan Rus had complex relations with its neighbors, alternating between alliance and warfare.

options.label: D
options.text: The Kievan Rus was a nomadic tribe.

multiple-choice.question: What was the primary cause of the decline of Kievan Rus?

options.label: A
options.text: The region's tribes were united under a single leader.

options.label: B
options.text: The Kievan Rus was conquered by the Mongols.

options.label: C
options.text: Fratricidal disputes over succession among the region's princes eroded central power.

options.label: D
options.text: The Kievan Rus was a peaceful and prosperous state.

multiple-choice.question: What was the impact of the Fourth Crusade on the Kievan Rus?

options.label: A
options.text: It brought wealth and prosperity to the region.

options.label: B
options.text: It led to the decline of the Byzantine Empire.

options.label: C
options.text: It devastated the trade integral to Rus wealth and power.

options.label: D
options.text: It had no impact on the Kievan Rus.

multiple-choice.question: Who was the leader of the Mongol hoard that conquered the Kievan Rus?
What was the outcome of the Mongol conquest of the Kievan Rus?

options.label: A
options.text: The region was united under a single leader.

options.label: B
options.text: The Kievan Rus was destroyed and its people were scattered.

options.label: C
options.text: The Mongols conquered the Kievan Rus, leading to its eventual division into eastern and western regions.

options.label: D
options.text: The region was left untouched by the Mongols.

multiple-choice.question: What was the significance of the city of Moscow in the history of the Kievan Rus?

options.label: A
options.text: It was the capital of the Kievan Rus.

options.label: B
options.text: It was a remote trading post that grew to challenge the power of the Khans.

options.label: C
options.text: It was a city that was destroyed by the Mongols.

options.label: D
options.text: It was a city that was founded by the Vikings.

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of the division of the Kievan Rus after the Mongol conquest?

options.label: A
options.text: The region was united under a single leader.

options.label: B
options.text: The Kievan Rus was destroyed and its people were scattered.

options.label: C
options.text: The western regions came under the influence of Poland and Lithuania, while the eastern regions remained under Mongol rule, and the city of Moscow grew in power.

options.label: D
options.text: The region was left untouched by the Mongols.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the legacy of the Kievan Rus in modern times?

options.label: A
options.text: The region is still united under a single leader.

options.label: B
options.text: The Kievan Rus had no impact on modern society.

options.label: C
options.text: The former lands of the Kievan Rus developed differences in society, culture, and language that remain to the present day.

options.label: D
options.text: The region is still a nomadic tribe.

title: How misused modifiers can hurt your writing

multiple-choice.question: What is a common grammatical mistake that can dramatically change the meaning of a sentence?
Which of the following is an example of a misplaced modifier?

options.label: A
options.text: "The teacher gave the student a book."

options.label: B
options.text: "Having studied for hours, the student felt confident."

options.label: C
options.text: "The student, who had studied for hours, felt confident."

options.label: D
options.text: "The teacher gave the student a book, which was very old."

multiple-choice.question: What is a dangling modifier?

options.label: A
options.text: A modifier that appears to be modifying nothing at all

options.label: B
options.text: A modifier that is too vague

options.label: C
options.text: A modifier that is too long

options.label: D
options.text: A modifier that is too short

multiple-choice.question: How can a dangling modifier be corrected?

options.label: A
options.text: By adding more words to the sentence

options.label: B
options.text: By giving the modifier something to modify

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a squinting modifier?

options.label: A
options.text: "Robbers who steal chocolate bunnies rapidly attract the outrage of onlookers."

options.label: B
options.text: "Having robbed the bank in record time, it was possible to make off with the town's chocolate rabbit as well."

options.label: C
options.text: "The town with world's largest chocolate bunny robbed by thief."

options.label: D
options.text: "The student, who had studied for hours, felt confident."

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of a modifier in a sentence?

options.label: B
options.text: To add information about other parts of a sentence

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following sentences is an example of a modifier being used correctly?

options.label: A
options.text: "The town with world's largest chocolate bunny robbed by thief."

options.label: B
options.text: "Having robbed the bank in record time, it was possible to make off with the town's chocolate rabbit as well."

options.label: C
options.text: "Robbers who steal chocolate bunnies rapidly attract the outrage of onlookers."

options.label: D
options.text: "The student, who had studied for hours, felt confident."

multiple-choice.question: What can be done to a squinting modifier to make it clear what it is modifying?

options.label: B
options.text: Give the modifier something to modify

options.label: D
options.text: Add more words to the sentence

multiple-choice.question: Why is it important to avoid verbal ambiguity in sentences?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it makes the sentence sound more formal

options.label: B
options.text: Because it makes the sentence sound more informal

options.label: C
options.text: Because it makes the sentence clear and easy to understand

options.label: D
options.text: Because it makes the sentence longer

multiple-choice.question: What is the main task of a writer when it comes to modifiers in sentences?

options.label: A
options.text: To add as many modifiers as possible

options.label: B
options.text: To make the sentence sound more formal

options.label: C
options.text: To avoid verbal ambiguity by making it clear which parts of the sentence modifiers belong to
